'Cyclopentanepentone', also known as 'leuconic acid', is a hypothetical organic
compound with formula C 5O 5, the fivefold ketone of
cyclopentane. It would be an oxide of carbon (an oxocarbon), indeed a pentamer
of carbon monoxide.

As of 2000, the compound had yet to be synthesized in bulk, but there have been
reports of trace synthesis.
